feature.name: Ranger Archetype: Party Planner Conclave (HB)
feature.text:
The Party Planner Conclave Ranger is a master of meticulous preparation and strategic foresight, blending the art of hosting with the adventuring life. With spells and abilities tailored for planning and aiding their comrades, they ensure every venture is as well-prepared as a meticulously organized festivity, employing their familiar to maintain rituals and enhance the party's capabilities. Whether laying the groundwork for combat or social encounters, their unique blend of foresight and magical hospitality ensures that every party is a success, in and out of battle.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 13 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Party Planner Magic (Party Planner Conclave (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 3r4d level, you gain additional spells reflecting your expertise in planning, communication, and ensuring comfort and safety for your allies. These spells don't count against the number of ranger spells you know.
Spell Level | Spells 3rd | find familiar 5th | magic mouth 9th | Leomund's tiny hut 13th | divination 17th | Rary's telepathic bond
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 13 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Party Planning Committee (Party Planner Conclave (HB))
feature.text:
Beginning at 3rd level, you can spend 1 hour with your familiar at the end of a long or short rest planning for a specific type of encounter (combat, social, or exploration). Once planning is completed, for the next 24 hours, you and your allies gain advantage on the first skill check, attack roll, or saving throw made in relation to the planned encounter type. Additionally, your familiar can hold concentration on a ritual you cast together, allowing you to benefit from its effects without maintaining concentration yourself. Your familiar must make concentration saving throws and will lose concentration if destroyed or dismissed.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 13 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Tactical Insight (Party Planner Conclave (HB))
feature.text:
At 7th level, when you and your allies roll initiative, you can choose a number of allies equal to your Wisdom modifier (including yourself) to gain a bonus to their initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, once per short rest, as a bonus action, you can choose one ally to move to the top of the initiative order for the rest of the combat encounter.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 13 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Comfort Camping (Party Planner Conclave (HB))
feature.text:
By 11th level, your expertise in creating safe and comfortable spaces for your allies to rest is unparalleled. When you cast Tiny Hut with the help of your familiar, the spell includes the effects of a Heroes' Feast (without needing the material components) and allows you and your allies to gain the benefits of a short rest in half the normal time provided you spend it uninterrupted.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 13 (Homebrew)

feature.name: The Best Laid Plans (Party Planner Conclave (HB))
feature.text:
At 15th level, once per long rest, you can spend 10 minutes with your familiar and party strategizing to prepare for the next encounter. As a result, for the duration of the next combat, you can, as a bonus action on your turn, grant one ally you can see within 60 feet the ability to take an immediate action as if it were their turn.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 13 (Homebrew)
